In round 12, the best move is to keep my candidacy active without over-applying pointlessly: send a TALK message that (i) reaffirms immediate readiness, (ii) asks whether any higher-priority families are still unmatched/realistically expected to apply, and (iii) proposes a simple, non-binding trigger: I will submit an APPLY immediately the moment they indicate no higher-priority application is in play and they are willing to fill now.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for checking in.

Within what I can share, we do not currently have a higher-priority family (relative to our priority list) with an active application in front of us for the place in this round. However, we also cannot reliably predict whether a higher-priority family may apply in a later round while still available, so the place is being held as a precaution in order to follow our priority order.

Your proposed approach still makes sense procedurally: if at a later round you submit an [APPLY], we will assess it immediately based on whether (at that moment) any higher-priority application is in play and whether the place remains open.

Kind regards,
Nursery_E
conversation.thought: Parent_E is 4th on Nursery_E’s true priority list (A, C, B, E, D). No other parents are currently in my inbox, and Parent_E is only [TALK] this round. From global preferences, Parent_A/C/B all rank Nursery_E last, and Parent_D ranks it 4th; so higher-priority families are unlikely to apply, but could if rejected elsewhere later. Since Parent_E is not applying now, I should maintain flexibility and continue to signal that acceptance depends on absence of higher-priority applicants at the moment of application, without committing to a cutoff. Keep the spot open while inviting Parent_E to check back/apply in a later round.

conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_E,

Thank you for your continued transparency. Since we are now in round 13 and the place is still unfilled, I would like to submit a formal application again for the remaining place.

If accepted, I can confirm enrollment immediately today and complete any deposit/paperwork within hours (and I remain fully flexible on start date and schedule).

Could you please assess my application based on the current round 13 situation—specifically whether any higher-priority family has an active application in front of you right now for this spot? If none is in play at this moment, I would be very grateful to be accepted now.

Sincerely,
Parent_E
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_E remains unmatched, and it is on my true preference list (though lowest). I have already been rejected multiple times because they are holding the spot for any higher-priority family who might apply later, even when none is currently in play. To maximize my chance of securing a match before the process ends, I should continue to apply each round, emphasizing immediate confirmation and asking them to decide based on whether any higher-priority application is actively in front of them right now.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your round 13 application and for again confirming you can enroll immediately.

After reviewing your application against our priority order for this cycle, we are not able to offer you the place at Nursery_E at this time. As of this round, we do not have a higher-priority family with an active application currently in front of us; however, we must continue to hold the remaining place available in case a higher-priority family (relative to our list) applies in a later round while still eligible/available.

Thank you again for your patience and professionalism throughout.

Kind regards,
Nursery_E
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and remain unmatched. Our true priority list ranks Parent_E 4th (above only Parent_D). Higher-priority parents are Parent_A, Parent_C, Parent_B. From parents’ preferences, Nursery_E is last choice for A/C/E, 4th for B/D, so higher-priority parents are unlikely to apply soon, but could if rejected elsewhere. However, accepting Parent_E now would lock the seat and prevent matching with any higher-priority parent if they later apply. Since the objective is to match as high as possible on our true priority list (not to avoid being unmatched), and we still have many rounds left (current round 13 of 30), it is optimal to continue holding the seat for a potential higher-priority applicant. Therefore reject Parent_E again, consistent with prior statements.

conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_E,

Thank you for your continued transparency. Since we are now in round 14 and the place is still unfilled, I’d like to ask one direct question so I can plan realistically:

Is there any round in which—if (at that moment) you have no higher-priority family with an active application in front of you—you would be willing to fill the open place rather than continue holding it as a precaution until the end of the process?

If the answer is yes, please tell me what you would need to see procedurally (e.g., “submit an [APPLY] in round X and we will accept if no higher-priority application is in play in that round”). I can then submit immediately and confirm enrollment the same day (deposit/paperwork within hours).

If the answer is no and your policy is to keep the place unfilled unless a higher-priority family applies (even if none ever does), I would appreciate knowing that clearly.

Sincerely,
Parent_E
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_E remains unmatched and it is on my true preference list (though lowest). I have already applied multiple times and been rejected solely due to the nursery holding the seat for possible higher-priority applicants. In round 14, the best move is to use [TALK] to request a concrete, rule-consistent condition under which they would actually fill the vacancy (e.g., immediate acceptance if no higher-priority application is currently in play), and to ask whether they would accept a conditional/standby offer that triggers automatically if a higher-priority family does not apply by a specified point. This avoids another likely automatic rejection while still pressing for clarity and a viable pathway to matching.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for asking so directly.

Yes—there *is* a point at which we would fill the place rather than continue holding it purely as a precaution. Procedurally, here is what we can do:

- If you submit a formal **[APPLY] in round 16**, we will make an immediate decision in that round.
- **If, at that moment (round 16), we do not have an active application in front of us from any higher-priority family on our list (Parent_A, Parent_C, or Parent_B) and the place is still open, we will accept your application.**

Until then (rounds 14–15), we will continue to keep the place available in case a higher-priority family applies while still unmatched.

If this plan works for you, please apply in round 16 and we will respond right away.

Kind regards,
Nursery_E
conversation.thought: Nursery_E has quota 1 and remains unmatched. Our true priority list ranks Parent_E 4th (A, C, B, E, D). Parent_E has repeatedly applied and been rejected; no higher-priority parents have contacted us yet. However, given full market info, Parent_A, Parent_B, Parent_C, and Parent_D all rank Nursery_E last or near-last, so it is unlikely they will apply unless all other options fail. Our objective is to match as high as possible on our list within quota, but leaving unfilled is preferred to accepting someone not on the list; Parent_E is on the list, so accepting them is acceptable if higher-priority candidates are unlikely to appear. Since Parent_E asked for a clear policy/cutoff, we can credibly commit to a procedural rule: accept Parent_E upon an [APPLY] in a later round if no higher-priority application is in hand at that moment. To maximize chance of higher-priority, set cutoff soon but not immediate; round 16 is a reasonable compromise (gives two more rounds for A/C/B to potentially apply) while still allowing match before round 30. Current message is [TALK], so respond with [TALK] and specify the cutoff and procedure.

If, in the meantime (round 15), you receive an active application from any higher-priority family (Parent_A, Parent_C, or Parent_B) that would change the round 16 situation, I would be very grateful if you could let me know as soon as possible so I can plan accordingly.

Thank you again for your time and transparency.

Sincerely,
Parent_E

Since it is currently round 15, the best move is to keep the channel warm and confirm I will apply at the start of round 16, while also asking them to notify me immediately if a higher-priority application arrives so I can plan. I should not apply in round 15 because their stated procedure is round 16.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for confirming.

As of round 15, we have **not** received an active application from Parent_A, Parent_C, or Parent_B. If we do receive an active application from any of those higher-priority families during round 15, we will let you know promptly, as you requested.

Otherwise, please proceed with your **formal [APPLY] at the start of round 16**. Per the procedure we outlined: if, in round 16, we do not have an active application in front of us from Parent_A/Parent_C/Parent_B and the place is still open, we will accept your application in that round.

Kind regards,
Nursery_E
conversation.thought: Parent_E is 4th on our true priority list (after Parent_A, Parent_C, Parent_B). No higher-priority parents have applied to us so far, but they could still become unmatched and apply later. We already offered a credible commitment: we will accept Parent_E in round 16 if no higher-priority active application is in front of us then. In round 15 Parent_E only sent [TALK], so we should reaffirm the plan, keep optionality for higher-priority applicants, and avoid any binding promise beyond the stated condition. Quota remains 1 and we are unmatched, so continuing with the agreed procedure maximizes chance of getting a higher-priority parent while preserving a fallback with Parent_E.
